intro: Phlox ovata var. pulchra, commonly known as the showy phlox, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces clusters of showy, fragrant flowers in shades of pink to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, sandy or loamy soils. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for gardens and natural landscapes.
